ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: the course provided a holistic understanding of redistributive policies tied to an understanding of the political climate that brings about these types of policies
US Politics, inequality and distribution of political and economic power, and its effects on democracy.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I appreciated the structure. It could be improved with slightly more guidance on the final paper.

The course is very American focused, which the professors are very open about, but it is just something to be aware of if you have more international interests. additionally, as it is a small seminar, your engagement will depend heavily on the engagement of your peer group so some weeks, if no one has done the reading, the class will be very disengaged and boring.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I have recommended this course to other students and I will continue to do so! I very much hope it continues to be offered.
Yes! I very much enjoyed this course
Yes. It is a good opportunity to write a paper with relative freedom on the topic that you want to write about.
